availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joel H. Clubb (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth “Betsy” Ann Clubb. Father of Burlington Clubb, Prentice Clubb, Cassius Clubb, and Mariam Barton, Lutitia Long, Kossuth Clubb, Roxilane Clubb Rees, Artemisia Clubb Magruder, Scottie Clubb Campbell, and Socrates Clubb. Resident of Henry County in 1840. Owned six enslaved persons in Henry County in 1840. Farmer in Henry County in 1850 Owned five enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 177B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Bethlehem, p. 249B-250A.
